remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve been experiencing a left groin mass and increased swelling in your left leg. Can you describe if the swelling or mass has changed in size, discomfort, or any other symptoms over the past few weeks?

remedi_labels.value: change in size of swelling or mass
other symptoms over the past few weeks

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Uh, yeah, thanks for seeing me. Honestly, my main concern right now is the pain where I had the surgery—it’s been pretty uncomfortable lately. I’m not sure if that’s normal after the operation or if something else is going on.

remedi_labels.value: pain where I had the surgery
Is it normal to have pain after the operation or is something else going on?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for sharing your concerns about the post-operative pain—that’s completely understandable, and I want to make sure we address your discomfort. Can you tell me if the pain at your surgical site is constant, or does it come and go, and have you noticed any redness, swelling, or drainage from the area since your operation?

remedi_labels.value: Thank you for sharing your concerns about the post-operative pain—that’s completely understandable, and I want to make sure we address your discomfort.

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… the pain at the surgical site is pretty much always there, but it gets worse if I move around too much. I haven’t really noticed any drainage or anything like that. Actually, I’ve also been having some oral pain lately, which has been bothering me too.

Thank you for letting me know about both your post-operative pain and the new oral discomfort. To help guide my assessment, can you describe the oral pain in more detail—such as where it is located, whether it’s constant or comes and goes, and if you’ve noticed any swelling, sores, or difficulty eating?

Yeah, um… the oral pain is mostly on the left side of my mouth. It kind of comes and goes, but lately it’s been more constant. I haven’t really seen any pains, but eating’s been a little harder because of it. And, uh, the pain from the left groin mass is still there too—it just feels uncomfortable most of the time.

remedi_labels.value: oral pain mostly on the left side of mouth
oral pain comes and goes, lately more constant
eating has been harder because of oral pain
left groin mass feels uncomfortable most of the time

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for describing your symptoms in detail. To better understand your condition, can you tell me if the numbness on the lateral aspect of your left thigh has changed recently—either in terms of severity, area affected, or whether it is constant or intermittent?

remedi_labels.value: numbness on the lateral aspect of left thigh

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Let me think… Yeah, the numbness on the side of my left thigh has kind of gotten a bit worse, I think. It used to come and go, but now it feels pretty constant. And, um, the swelling in my left leg seems to have increased too—it just feels heavier and more uncomfortable lately. Should I be worried about that?

remedi_labels.value: numbness on the side of left thigh
Should I be worried about that?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried, especially with the increase in swelling and numbness in your left leg—those symptoms can be concerning after surgery. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any changes in skin color, temperature, or the development of any wounds or ulcers on your left leg since these symptoms have worsened?

remedi_labels.value: increase in swelling and numbness in left leg
changes in skin color on left leg
development of wounds or ulcers on left leg

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Uh, let me think… I haven’t noticed any wounds or ulcers on my left leg, and the skin color looks about the same to me. Maybe it feels a little cooler sometimes, but I’m not totally sure. I do have some mild weakness when I try to lift my leg—like with hip flexion—and actually, both of my legs and feet seem more swollen than before. It’s just really uncomfortable, and I’m hoping to get some relief.

remedi_labels.value: no wounds or ulcers on left leg
skin color looks about the same
left leg feels a little cooler sometimes
both legs and feet more swollen than before

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for sharing these details about your symptoms. To further guide my assessment, have you experienced any changes in sensation—such as tingling, burning, or loss of experiencing—beyond the numbness on the lateral aspect of your left thigh, either in your lower leg or foot?

remedi_labels.value: changes in sensation such as tingling, burning, or loss of experiencing beyond numbness on the lateral aspect of left thigh, in lower leg or foot

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually—now that you mention it, I’ve noticed some tingling in my left foot, especially around the heel. It’s not as strong as the numbness on my thigh, but it’s there. I did have a soft tissue injury on my left heel a while back, and I’m not sure if that’s related or not. 

Also, I wanted to ask—could all these symptoms be from the pelvic mass? It just feels like everything’s kind of connected, and I’m honestly pretty uncomfortable most of the time. Is there anything else I should be doing to help with the swelling or pain?

remedi_labels.value: soft tissue injury on left heel
asking if symptoms could be from pelvic mass
asking what else can be done for swelling or pain

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for sharing that you’ve noticed increased swelling and persistent numbness. To help with my assessment, have you experienced any difficulty with movement or walking—such as changes in your gait, increased fatigue, or instability—since these symptoms have progressed?

Yeah, I have noticed it’s harder to get around lately. My legs feel heavy from all the edema, and I get tired a lot quicker than I used to—like, even just walking across the room wears me out now. I guess you could say I’m pretty deconditioned at this point. Sometimes I feel a little unsteady, especially if I try to stand up too fast.

Is there anything I can do to help with the lower extremity edema or build my strength back up? I just want to feel a little more comfortable and maybe get some relief from all this swelling and pain.

Thank you for explaining how the swelling and numbness are affecting your mobility and daily activities. To further guide my assessment, have you noticed any changes in bladder or bowel function—such as difficulty urinating, incontinence, or constipation—since your symptoms of lower extremity swelling and numbness have progressed?

remedi_labels.value: swelling and numbness affecting mobility and daily activities
changes in bladder or bowel function such as difficulty urinating, incontinence, or constipation since progression of lower extremity swelling and numbness

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, um… actually, now that you ask, I have had a bit more trouble with constipation lately. I don’t think I’ve had any symptoms with urinating or incontinence, but the constipation has definitely gotten worse since the lower extremity swelling started increasing. It’s just one more thing making me uncomfortable.

Is that something I should be worried about? Could the pelvic mass or all this edema be causing it? I just want to make sure I’m not missing anything serious, and honestly, I’d really appreciate any advice on how to get some relief from all these symptoms.

remedi_labels.value: Could the pelvic mass or edema be causing constipation?
Is constipation something I should be worried about?
Advice on how to get relief from symptoms

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious, especially with the persistent swelling, numbness, and discomfort you’ve described. Based on your symptoms—including increased left leg edema, constant numbness on the lateral thigh, weakness with hip flexion, and worsening constipation—it’s possible that the pelvic mass is affecting nearby nerves and blood vessels, contributing to both your neurological and vascular symptoms. To help guide my assessment further, have you experienced any new or worsening back pain, or pain radiating from your pelvis into your lower back or down your leg?

remedi_labels.value: pelvic mass affecting nerves and blood vessels
increased left leg edema, constant numbness on the lateral thigh, weakness with hip flexion, worsening constipation
new or worsening back pain, pain radiating from pelvis into lower back or down leg

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually—I have noticed some new back pain lately. It’s mostly in my lower back, and sometimes it feels like it’s radiating from the pelvis down into my left leg. The pain isn’t always sharp, but it’s kind of a deep pain that just sticks around, and it gets worse if I’m up for too long or try to move around more than usual.

With all these neurological and vascular symptoms—like the edema, numbness, and weakness—should I be worried about permanent nerve damage? And is there anything else I can do besides just taking pain meds? I’m honestly just really uncomfortable and hoping there’s something that can help with the swelling and pain.

remedi_labels.value: new back pain, mostly in lower back, radiating from pelvis to left leg, deep persistent pain, worsens with prolonged standing or movement
neurological and vascular symptoms: edema, numbness, weakness
asking for alternatives to pain medication
asking for help with swelling and pain

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious, especially with the persistent swelling, numbness, and discomfort you’ve described. Honestly, all these symptoms—the edema, numbness, weakness, and now the lower back pain—are making me pretty anxious.
